title.narrative: Efficient Milling and Marketing of Coffee II

description.narrative:
MCCMMCU was set up in 2014 with the aim of milling and marketing all coffee from Meru county. The union is an affiliation of Meru central coffee cooperative union, Meru north coffee union and Imenya (which is a registrered cooperative belonging to large estate owners). The union should be serving approximately 47 primary cooperatives, however, only 31 primary cooperatives utilised their services in 2017 though more are expected in 2018. The union was able to mill and market more than 720 tonnes of clean coffee in 2017 and for the first time since inception saw a remarkable improvement. Due to some serious interventions in 2017 on operational efficiency enhancement, governance, financial management and precise execution, MCCMCU were able to improve the bottom line by upto 50%. In 2018, it is expected that such interventions will continue and the areas of focus expanded to include professionalisation of existing management structures, continuous strengthening of governance and improvement of financial management to support the milling and marketing of upto 35000 bags of parchment coffee (1225 tonnes of clean coffee) in 2018.
Project Activities Coordinate and communicate with members on matters coffee quality, quantity and timelines
Enhance the operational efficiency of milling and marketing by reviewing the BPR recommendations together with Audited financial statements of 2017 Develop/Enhance a quarterly KPI dashboard Develop a new strategic plan Build the capacity of the marketing staff and marketing sub-committee Develop a board charter Follow-up of the governance trainings Follow-up of the financial Management training Training the management staff and Finance sub-committee on budgeting and thereafter 3 days on the job coaching Services Advice Mission on strengthening internal controls Event: Training Basic Financial Management training Governance training FACT follow-up workshop Event: Exchange visit Exchange visit to AFCA conference in Kampala
1. Attain optimal operational efficiency for MCCMCU to break-even 2. Professionalize further the governance and financial management to support the goal to break-evening 3. Deepen the marketing knowledge within MCCMCU to be able compete for the global export market. 4. Re-align the strategic objectives of MCCMCU for the next three years for them to be able to deliver value to its members.
